Reviews.Title: “School trip from hell.”
Reviews.Author: RachelFreitag
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at around half 5 in the morning after a 7 hour bus journey from Krakow to find that our rooms would not be available until 1 o'clock in the afternoon. They also demanded a 20 euro deposit from each person before we could have breakfast. Eventually they let us have two of our rooms so that all 50 of us could get changed and freshen up - when really we wanted a sleep and a shower. When we got our room the bathroom decor was hideous as if it were from the 70's. On top of this the room stank of cigarettes when it had been clearly stated on my friend's health from that we was asthmatic - this information had been sent to the hotels prior to our stay. We also found the staff unfriendly and unhelpful. A terrible hotel in such a lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: katarina5358
Reviews.Content: Stopped for 4 days in August, 2011. All was very pleasant: early settling in number; friendly ladies on a reception-Inessa and Victoria; an excellent breakfast; faultlessly pure bed-clothes and the towels changing daily; a bathroom with a window, fresh repair and decent serviceable equipment; big flat TV on a wall. The hotel is conveniently located: very close to metro station and bus stops, to Tegel on public transport no more a half an hour. Very much it was pleasant, I will stop now in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad and very expensive - unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bobik2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the 3rd floor of an apartment building. The staff was very unfriendly. On check in they do not explain anything to guests and they only look how to cash the money as quick as possible. When I asked for some information, the receptionist felt bothered. Parking in front of the Hotel costs 7EUR per day and it is nearly not possible to find a place. There was a strange smell in the corridor. On check out I was asked to pay for the internet that was very slow and not really useful. There was no writing desk in the room. To ask for 120 EUR even during the ITB it is daring.

Reviews.Title: “A GOOD HOTEL IN A CENTRAL LOCSATYION - EXCELLENT BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: LYDIAANDJOHN
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Kudam for our second night in Berlin at a very reasonable price and found the Comet an excellent hotel - well located, clean, quiet, good breakfast. Similar to a Travelodge in the UK in terms of fittings/facilities, with a beautiful 1900s Reception area. You can walk from the central Kufurstendam station in about 15 minutes, or you can go to the less easily accessible adenauer platz - 2 minutes walk to the hotel. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal!”
Reviews.Author: Ga_bi_91
Reviews.Content: I decided to book Hotel Comet because it's located on Ku'damm one important and busy avenue in Berlin. It's really close to the Adenaurplatz U-Bahn station and there are some restaurants close to it. Despite its great location, the hotel fares are not exorbitant. For a room with shower and toilet facilities I paid 49 euros (one night). Including breakfast, which was pretty good, by the way. My room was tidy and clean. It was simple, but I don't have any problems with that. For me, as long as the room is comfortable, clean and the hotel is in a nice neighbourhood, I'm OK. The TV was tiny but, again, that's fine by me, since I only used the room to shower and sleep. When I got to the hotel, before the check in time, my room was note ready yet, but I could left my backpack at the reception. There were 3 receptionists during my stay there and they all spoke English (one of them, not so fluently). All of them were really nice and helpful! From the Schönefeld Airport you can take the X7 or the 171 bus to the RUDOW U-bahn station and then go all the way to Adenauerplatz on the line 7. Not so sure it would be a good idea to do this late at night if you're a woman travelling by yourself - I didn't. The reson i say this is because the whole journey takes about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Summing up, I really liked this hotel and would certainly return if going back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nevyle
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean. Our room was in a corner and had en-suite facilities and a small balcony. Plenty of hot water. The only downside was that the plug did not work in the sink and the TV was a little to high on the wall. If you want to use the hairdryer, the plug is under the light in the bathroom. It was clean and basic. High ceilings, typical of german living. The buffet breakfast was extremely good and you could have as much as you wanted. The staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel is at the bottom end of K'dam, with Adenaurplatz underground and bus stop only a few minutes walk to take you to the centre of Berlin near Zoologischer Garden. The transport system is easy to use, just remember to activate your rail /travelcard! The fact you could use whatever form of transport with your card is brilliant. I would use this hotel again. However, while in Berlin, this last week, the weather was very hot! It was great to be back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad staff!”
Reviews.Author: CR49_9
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice - it was spacious. The breakfast was also good and the location is good, right by Adenaeurplatz U-Bahn. But this place is a middle ground between a hostel and a hotel. The double bed was actually two twins pushed together with two seperate, really thin blankets....in 2 degree weather in November! The furniture was a bit like college dorm furniture. I thought the bathroom was ok until I took a shower one morning and the water was freezing. I complained and the lady at the reception desk clearly didn't care. Also, their "left luggage" doesn't seem very safe to me, it's just left in the main reception area. The hotel is ok if you're sight seeing and just coming back to sleep (but not shower!) but I think it would get pretty depressing if you spent any amount of time there. It's pretty cheap though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the only grand room in the hotel is the lobby. ;}”
Reviews.Author: Skylark42
Reviews.Content: We picked Hotel Comet out of many in our price range because it looked so 'belle epoque'. We imagined the rooms would be furnished as comfortably and grandly as the reception area. But to our disappointment the rooms were entirely ordinary: very small, and furnished with cheap, plasticky, old-fashioned fittings. Sound transmission from the adjacent rooms and the corridor was worse than average, which made it diificult to sleep. Having said that, it was warm, everything worked fine (incuding the tiny shower), the beds were comfortable and the breakfast, if simple, was perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pauline1946
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience at this hotel. Our room was a twin -bed double standard and although on the small side, it was fine for us as we spent most of our time out sightseeing. The shower room, included a wash basin and toilet which was, as mentioned in another review, in-room rather than en-suite. This was not a problem for us and it was always kept clean with fresh towels daily. Our room was at the back overlooking a courtyard and was very quiet. Breakfast was plentiful and offered a large choice. We found the staff most helpful. The hotel is located close to the u-bahn and so access to all parts of the city is good. It is a good walk to the Tiergarten and Zoo, but you could take public transport if necessary. In general, a good value, basic hotel if you don't long for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Careful when you travel”
Reviews.Author: BobFrank
Reviews.Content: It is a primitive place - a townhouse cheaply turned into a hotel - very thin walls and water that turns cold at 08.30. We went (unknowingly) in the messe period - so had to pay an average of 150 euro a night for a minimal twin room with shower (not en-suite but in-room!) without WC. We were forced to pay in full for the four nights in advance. When I reluctantly paid, I was told I could expect my money back if I were not going to stay. After the first, sleepless, night we asked for a better room or our money back. We were told we could pay for a better one, or we could leave but could expect no money back. The morning shift denied the promises of the previous evening, and claimed a management policy of no refunds. Incredibly hostile attitude - no customer service. We made the best of it with earplugs and enjoyed the good breakfast and good location. Pleasant staff if you don't want to leave. Could be a decent budget hotel for half the price!

Reviews.Title: “very good and value for money ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: Rossmann
Reviews.Content: . . . This hotel is very good. :) U can easily reach everything by BUS. Near bus station, U-bahn station Near " ROSSMANN ". . . Buffet is very rich. Staffs are nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel for berlin”
Reviews.Author: heavans
Reviews.Content: I think the other reviews are spot on. This place is definitely not fancy, and in the heat wave when I was there, it was a little unpleasant getting to sleep. But, that's the case everywhere. It had everything in the room, a super small bathroom but that was ok for me. I thought the breakfast was really excellent, actually, in comparison to the many others that I've had in Germany. Definitely good when you want to save money on hotels, and spend it elsewhere. A little far down on Ku'Damm than others, but you can walk to Zoo. Garten or take one of the many buses...

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Money”
Reviews.Author: sa-atlanta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comet in July 2004 and had a great experience. My goal was to spend my travel budget on tourist activities, rather than on a fancy hotel room which I would not enjoy most of the day. However, I also wanted a pleasant place to sleep at the end of the day. The room was clean, the staff was friendly enough, and the breakfast was good. My only complaint was that I could smell the smoker next door every morning, but hey it's Europe. Unless you're looking for a very fancy place, I would recommend the Comet.
